Remdesivir is widely distributed in the body, predominantly in bladder, kidneys, liver, prostate, mandibular salivary gland, pancreas, seminal vesicle, epididymis, and testes. It is administered by intravenous route, with a half-life of 0.84â€“1.04 hours. It gets eliminated mainly by renal (63%) and biliary excretion (27.8%) and shows poor penetration across the blood-brain barrier. It is metabolized partially by CYP2C8, CYP2D6, and CYP3A4 enzymes.
